entry.title: Game: Blazing Lazers (PCE, 1989)
entry.content:
I played through Blazing Lazers a few nights ago and tonight. This is a shooter from 1989 on the PC Engine.

I found the weapons to be really cool. I particularly liked the laser beam weapon that spread into weird shapes.

I found the hit box really annoying. The hit box is bigger than the ship graphic and wider than it is vertically, so it is really difficult to dodge properly, at least when compared to the modern danmaku shooters I normally play.

I used save states before and after bosses, plus throughout the final boss battle. In fact, my wife helped me restart a million times through a particular explosion.

Overall, I thought the game was fun, but I like modern shooters better. I didn't like it as much as the shooter that is in Retro Game Challenge, which is supposedly based on this game.
